intro: Conophytum hirtum, commonly known as the woolly conophytum, is a member of the Aizoaceae family native to southern Africa. It is a small, succulent plant characterized by its fleshy, rounded leaves covered in fine, white hairs. The plant typically grows in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, star-shaped flowers in shades of yellow and orange during the warmer months. Conophytum hirtum is popular among succulent enthusiasts for its unique appearance and easy care requirements.
